sermons.title: (1 Peter - Part 13): On Fashioning Ourselves as Christians
sermons.description: This is a sermon on being fashioned not after the world but after Christ. Tozer gives a thorough list of factors which will fashion our lives, whether for the good or bad. This sermon speaks of our lives before our being born again and how we need to fashion our lives according to our new nature which is holy in all conversation. God is holy and our walk as Christians need to be holy to as Tozer mentions.

sermons.title: (How to Get Out of a Religious Rut): Three Spiritual Laws
(OM Orientation) Discipline - Part 1
sermons.description: This is a practical look at Disciplining the thought life. He goes on to say that If you sow a thought, you reap an action. If you sow an action you reap a habit. If you sow a habit you reap a lifestyle. If you sow a lifestyle you reap an eternity. This is an excellent message for anyone who is worrisome, anxious and has an undisciplined thought life.

sermons.title: (OM Orientation) Discipline - Part 2
sermons.description: This is a practical look at Disciplining the thought life. He goes on to say that If you sow a thought, you reap an action. If you sow an action you reap a habit. If you sow a habit you reap a lifestyle. If you sow a lifestyle you reap an eternity. This is an excellent message for anyone who is worrisome, anxious and has an undisciplined thought life.

sermons.title: (People God Uses) 02 The Need for Faith
sermons.description: Chuck Smith continues his series on people used by God with focus on faith.  In Hebrews 11:6 we read that without faith it is impossible to please God for he who comes to God must believe that He is and He rewards those that truly seek Him.  The men and women that God uses believe in His promises and stand in faith upon those promises.  Paul reminds us in the Epistle to Romans that it is God who gives us a measure of faith (Romans 12:3).  The men and women that God uses are people of faith.

sermons.title: 79 Gospel Fellowships Readings (Intro)
sermons.description:
The importance of liturgy in the history of the Christian Church over the 2000 years cannot be underestimated. Some of the earliest hymns in the Church were chants or Scriptural truths read aloud in unison. To verbally proclaim in unison holy truths of God will have a great affect spiritually on the Assembly of believers to strengthen and unify them in the faith once delivered to the saints.1148
We are commended in the Scriptures to verbally proclaim our allegiance to the Son of God, confessing truths that we believe in our heart.1149 Though modern day evangelicalism is mostly non-liturgical this was not so in the early days of Christianity.
sermons.speaker_name: Principles For The Gathering of Believers

sermons.title: 80. What is required in the tenth commandment?
A Living Sacrifice - Part 1
sermons.description: This message starts with a brief summary of what Mr Washer preached earlier in the week. Then, after exhorting fathers in the fulfilling of their Biblical responsibilities, he turns to Romans 12:1-2 where the apostle Paul urges us to give our lives away; not for a cause, but to a Person. Our motivation for doing so is ‘the mercies of God’, which Mr Washer then explains. This laying down of one’s life is a once-and-for-all decision; but why does Paul say, Present your bodies? For one thing, it destroys the notion that a man can outwardly live in ungodliness whilst claiming that in his heart he really loves Jesus Christ. Furthermore, the things we do in our bodies are evidence of our sanctification and dedication to God. Mr Washer also examines in some detail what we put in to our bodies, revealing our responsibilities before God and men. He then considers in turn our eyes, ears, tongue, hands and feet, and how we clothe our bodies; he pleads with us to do all things to the glory of God.  (46 minutes).

sermons.title: A Living Sacrifice - Part 2
sermons.description: Part 2 opens with one more example of presenting our bodies a living sacrifice: the dangers of dating. This is so rarely taught that something has to be said from a Biblical basis. Parents are not teaching their children their responsibilities, and the church is not showing the parents how. Biblical counsel is this: don’t put yourself in the way of temptation. This issue is not a question of the intellect, it’s a question of the will: we know what’s right, we just don’t want to do it. Proceeding into v.2,  Mr Washer explains what it means to be not conformed to this world, both for individuals and for the church. He explains that the renewing of the mind is a total transformation, a supernatural creative work of God. He then examines the will of God, and how you will know it by its characteristics of being good, acceptable and perfect. This message outlines practical issues that we all have to deal with. Believing the doctrine is one thing; but is it a growing, practical reality in your life? If not, stop and deal with it, one step at a time.  (43 minutes)

sermons.title: A body for the Holy Spirit
sermons.description: Erlo Stegen exhorts us to live a life worthy of the gospel of Jesus christ. He specifically shows how God commands us to present our actual bodies on this earth to God for His service. So that the good and acceptable and perfect will of God can be completed in our life.

sermons.title: AT ONE WITH THE WILL OF GOD
sermons.description: There is nothing more wonderful in life than to experience God’s reality from day to day.   For then suffering loses its power over us, and prayers are answered.

sermons.title: AT ONE WITH THE WILL OF GOD
sermons.description: There is nothing more wonderful in life than to experience God’s reality from day to day, and to be united with Him in love. For then suffering loses its power over us, and prayers are answered.

sermons.title: Be Not Conformed To The World
Being Led by the Spirit
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson starts by defining “The Law of the Spirit of Life.” He talks about what the Holy Spirit is, and how the Holy Spirit gets confused with other spirits and feelings and gifts. He describes what can be done to foster spiritual maturity, so that we learn to tell when the Holy Spirit is active in our midst. He discusses very practical ways we can live by the Spirit. He says God will not have people who are not under law – the Holy Spirit is our Law. We are either under the Law of Moses or under the Law of the Spirit. (55 minutes, 58 seconds)

sermons.title: Boiling for Christ
sermons.description: The highest privilege in the world is to serve Jesus Christ, but our service can be misguided if we serve our own appetites, people, or the law.  "All of our serving," says John Piper, "is receiving service from Christ which He bought for us when He died."  In other words, serving Jesus is first trusting Jesus to serve me.

sermons.title: CMML Missions Conference 1993-02 Committment To Christ
Changed Into Christ's Image #7
sermons.description: Dr. Thompson says that Romans 8:1 is conditional – that we are without condemnation IF we are not living after the sinful nature, but after the Spirit. He says there are only two ways to live, two ways that you can approach any decision or action – either in the flesh or in the spirit. If you don’t live after the Spirit, you are still under condemnation. He discusses the difference between “the pursuit of happiness” and “the pursuit of righteousness.” He says the key to "living in the Spirit" can be found in Proverbs 3:5-6, “In all your ways acknowledge Him…” Dr. Thompson finishes by discussing some "big picture" elements, such as, why God created man as a response to the rebellion of the angels. Excellent sermon, very practical.

sermons.title: Chapel of the Air - Interview with Dr. Orr (part 2)
sermons.description: Habakkuk 2:2, 2 Chronicles 7:14. Dr. Orr discusses how he believed that Satan was the main hindrance to people understanding revival, and though he was a revival scholar, his intent was not to increase knowledge on the subject for the sake of increasing knowledge, but rather to increase knowledge of revival to enable people to be subjects of revival. He also talks about areas of the world where he believed revival was currently happening, along with some of the mistakes that people have made after revival has occurred.  "I shudder to hear of people who claim to be filled with the Holy Spirit without any holiness of life." Dr. Orr talks about how after years of revival work he kept himself renewed. "Evan Roberts once said to me 'always pray for a vision to match your faith'."

sermons.title: Christ Overcame Evil With Good, Do the Same
Christ the Man #2
sermons.description: This teaching shows us that we have the power to keep from being conformed to this world.  We can be transformed to be like Christ.  He too was tempted as a man but overcame—we have the same power within us through Christ.

sermons.title: Christmas Preparations
sermons.description: With the recent world events, Pastor Cymbala teaches about what we need to do to prepare for this Christmas. Romans 12:9-10, 14, 15-16, 18 (NIV)

sermons.title: Constant, Instant, Expectant
sermons.description: DELIVERED ON LORD'S-DAY MORNING, JUNE 22ND, 1879, BY C. H. SPURGEON, AT THE METROPOLITAN TABERNACLE, NEWINGTON. “Continuing instant in prayer.” - Romans 12:12. THIS is placed in connection with a large number of brief but very weighty precepts. Prayer has a distinct relationship to all Christian duties and graces. It is not possible for us to carry out the holy commands of our Lord Jesus unless we are abundant in supplication. The Romans at the time that Paul wrote to them were subject to persecution, and in this verse he mentions two remedies for impatience under such afflictions, remedies which are equally effectual under all the trials of life. The old physicians tell us of two antidotes against poison, the hot and the cold, and they dilate upon the special excellence of each of these: in like manner the apostle Paul gives us first the warm antidote - “Rejoicing in hope,” and then he gives us the cool antidote, “Patient in tribulation.” Either of these, or both together, will work wonderfully for the sustaining of the spirit in the hour of affliction; but it is to be observed, that neither of these remedies can be taken into the soul except they be mixed with a draught of prayer. Joy and patience are curative essences, but they must be dropped into a glass full of supplication, and then they will be wonderfully efficient. How can we “rejoice in hope” if we know nothing about prayer to the God of hope.

sermons.title: Do Not Avenge Yourselves, But Give Place to Wrath
Fit or Misfit? (part 4): Examples of the motivational gifts
Gifts In The Body Of Christ ~ Romans 12
God wants the total you
sermons.description: God has mercy on us each and every day. Whether you're a Christian or not, you are here by the grace of God. It is only His mercy that you are still alive. In Acts 5 we read of Ananias and Sapphira who died when they lied to the Holy Spirit. In 1Cor 10:8-11 Paul relates how the children of Israel were judged and killed when they committed fornication, murmured and tempted Christ. And these things happened to them as examples to us, so that we would be admonished not to do the same. If we therefore think of ourselves, the fact that we are still alive is only because of His mercy. God is gracious to you but if you carry on in sin you will be destroyed.

sermons.title: God’s Wrath: Vengeance Is Mine, I Will Repay, Says the Lord
Joshua’s Divine Commission
sermons.description: God called Joshua to lead Israel into the promised Land, to fulfill His promise of giving the Land to Abraham's descendants.  Just as He called Joshua,  if you are a child of God,  the Lord is calling you to a specific work as well.  Join us now as Pastor Brent teaches us about Joshua's Divine Commission.

sermons.title: Lavish Giving, Loving Guests, Living Christ
Live Peaceably with All, If Possible
Lord Let Your Fire Fall!
sermons.description: Brother Edgar shares a convicting message from the exhortation of brother Paul the Apostle to be a living sacrifice. He shares the old Testament type of what a sacrifice is and how the Lord is calling us in the New Covenant to be a sacrifice for our Lord. He shares many sins and reasons why we do not allow ourselves to be a sacrifice. Brother Edgar can be contacted at: edgarreich@revivalusacanada.org

sermons.title: New Life Baptist Church - Part 2
sermons.description: Speaking mostly to young people, Paul addresses a variety of issues. He encourages them to be separate from the world, to seek and to know the Lord, and to build their lives on the perceptive will of God as is found in the Word. He then finishes with a convicting message on relationships, courtship and the wisdom of fleeing youthful lusts.

sermons.title: Offer Your Bodies A Living Sacrifice
sermons.description: Paul Washer powerfully shares an exposition of Romans chapter 12 verse 1 on offering our life as a true sacrifice to God. He clearly shows that it must in light of the work of mercy and justification that God offers through His Son Jesus Christ. This is a powerful message calling for full surrender and holiness to the Lord.

sermons.title: Offering Your Bodies
sermons.description: In a continuation of his teaching in "Joy of Giving it All", Paul expounds further on why our bodies are to be a holy sacrifice onto the Lord. Revisiting his themes of dying to self and the holiness of God, he challenges listeners again to separate from the world and onto God. Yet, in humbleness, he also encourages that any walk of surrender to Him must be done in complete dependence upon Him as Lord of all.

sermons.title: Overcoming Evil With Good
sermons.description: An exposition on Romans 12:9-21. The theme of "overcoming evil with good" is the master and overriding principle of this passage of scripture. This principle goes deeper than what is seen at first appearance.

sermons.title: PERSEVERING PRAYER
sermons.description: If you haven’t experienced God’s power in your life, perhaps it’s because you haven’t experienced the power of PERSEVERING PRAYER! What is persevering prayer, and why is it more likely to be answered than other kinds of prayer? Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Steps To Personal Revival
sermons.description: Bill McLeod shares on the subject of a personal revival from the Word of God. He expresses clearly how the subject of revival and renewal is a very biblical topic and is needful for every Christian. He clearly shows how we can have revival, why we need revival and how to have a personal revival.

sermons.title: Steps To Personal Revival by Bill McLeod
sermons.description: Bill McLeod shares on the subject of a personal revival from the Word of God. He expresses clearly how the subject of revival and renewal is a very biblical topic and is needful for every Christian. He clearly shows how we can have revival, why we need revival and how to have a personal revival.

sermons.title: The Discovering And Delighting In God's Will
The Gifts of the Spirit
sermons.description: We see how all have at least one gift of the Spirit, how there are many different gifts, but all are from the same Spirit. We see how the gifts cannot be used properly but in accordance with scripture, and how that they will be used for the edification of believers and cannot profit selfish gain. Pastor Fitch talks mostly about the most contentious gift that of Tongues. We also see how no one person has all the gifts of the Spirit but we are supposed to have all the fruits of the Spirit.

sermons.title: The Joy of Giving it All (Part 1)
sermons.description: In his typical fashion, Paul presents a sermon on what he calls a key scripture. In this message, he encourages believers to give their whole lives to Christ and to explore the inexhaustible mercies of God.

sermons.title: The Joy of Giving it All (Part 2)
sermons.description: Have you put yourself at the disposal of God? In a continuation of his message, Paul specifies what it truly means to "present" oneself to God and the true joy He gives as you draw nearer to Him.

sermons.title: The Present Effects of Trembling at the Wrath of God
The Surrendered Life
sermons.description: Many of us make the claim that we live life totally committed to God but is that the complete truth.  Do we really give up body and possessions completely to God?  This is a message that should convict all who love God with all of their heart, soul, and mind.

sermons.title: Urge To Sin - The Mental Factor
Use the Inspired Scriptures to Rejoice in Hope
What Will Keep You on the Mission Field?
When Is It Right to Repay Evil With Pain?
You Can Fulfill God's Perfect Plan
sermons.description: Sacrifice and Sovereignty is the balance of Chrstian Life. Painful self-denial and submitting our wills to God ensure we have walked in the perfect will of God. Amongst all the problems and doubts we can trust a loving Heavenly Father that He is desiring and leads us into His perfect will for our life's. Into a life full of good works that glorifies the death of Christ for our sins giving us eternal life.

sermons.title: You Can Fulfill God's Perfect Plan by Zac Poonen
sermons.description: Sacrifice and Sovereignty is the balance of Chrstian Life. Painful self-denial and submitting our wills to God ensure we have walked in the perfect will of God. Amongst all the problems and doubts we can trust a loving Heavenly Father that He is desiring and leads us into His perfect will for our life's. Into a life full of good works that glorifies the death of Christ for our sins giving us eternal life.
